title: geth crashes when creating a new account in ethereumwallet (light mode)
body:
#### System information

```
$ geth version
Geth
Version: 1.7.3-stable
Git Commit: 4bb3c89d44e372e6a9ab85a8be0c9345265c763a
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.9.1
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/lib/go-1.9

$ cat /etc/lsb-release 
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=17.10
DISTRIB_CODENAME=artful
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 17.10"
```

#### Expected behaviour
no crash

#### Actual behaviour
crash

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
1) start geth with --light
2) try and fail to use mist (creating account will crash geth)
3) try and fail to use ethereumwallet (same thing)
4) try again with `geth --syncmode "light"` (same thing)

My terminal history clipped the top of the stack trace.
Also crashes when trying to send funds through the gui.
It was on a 1GB machine. Worked after I increased memory to 2GB. If it's an out of memory situation, it would be great to print appropriate error message when it crashes.

The standard account crypto requires 256MB memory for a single keystore decryption operation. Unfortunately the `secp256k1` crypto library is written in C, and so if C goes out of memory, it displays an ugly SEGFAULT instead of explicitly stating it went out of memory. 

I'll leave this issue open as a future idea to maybe somehow improve upon, but I'm not sure we can do much about it.

Solution here is to use `--lightkdf` on memory constrained devices. That, I guess, wasn't available vai Mist, but since mist is now deprecated, anyone who uses geth on a constrained device can just ensure to pass that option
